content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `ispersonal` that returns a trait if the provided Vehicle type is a personal vehicle for everyday driving. All vehicles are subtypes of AbstractVehicle. Function must work for types: Car, Motorcycle, Bus, Truck. The first two should return true, the latter two should return false . The function should default to false for any other subtype of AbstractVehicle. Provide an example.

```julia
abstract type AbstractVehicle end

mutable struct Car <: AbstractVehicle end
mutable struct Motorcycle <: AbstractVehicle end
mutable struct Bus <: AbstractVehicle end
mutable struct Truck <: AbstractVehicle end

function ispersonal(vehicle::Type{<:AbstractVehicle}})
    vehicle === Car || vehicle === Motorcycle
end

# Example
personal_vehicles = [Car(), Motorcycle()]
non_personal_vehicles = [Bus(), Truck()]

for v in personal_vehicles
    @assert ispersonal(typeof(v)) == true
end

for v in non_personal_vehicles
    @assert ispersonal(typeof(v)) == false
end
```

In this example, the `ispersonal` function determines if a given vehicle type is a personal vehicle. The function uses a type comparison to return `true` for `Car` and `Motorcycle`, and `false` for `Bus` and `Truck`. The example also includes assertions to verify the correctness of the function.
